titleStmt.title: R. J. Voring et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4151

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To the Hon -- Bramlette Governor of the Comwth of Kentucky.
Your petitioners would respectfully state that at the aug term 1862 of the Carroll Circuit Court James Humphrey was fined sixty Dollars for keeping a tippling house.

Your petitioners would state that he is a man of no means, a daily laborer, requiring all he can realize to support himself and family. He can give no security. You petitioners believe that is sufficient time is granted him he can raise the means to satisfy said fine
Your petitioners therefore pray that a respite of twelve months be granted him.

R. T. Voring S. C. C
T. W. Bates
R. W. Masterson
H M Pryor
John Hogan Late Clk
A R Gaunt C C C C
E. P. Hamilton
Allen Hanks C. C. C. C
Jno. J. Orr Cty Atto
James Humphrey of Carroll Co fined for keeping Tippling house prays for remission of fine.

Refused
T. E. Bramlette
Sept 7th 1863
Carroll
Cir Court
